item.title: Outside number 20 Dartmouth Park Avenue, 26th August
item.description:
I first emailed you about this overgrown tree over a year ago, asking the council to prune it. I received a written assurance that it would be pollarded last year (2024) in Autumn after the leaves dropped. This did not happen and the problem is now of course worse. There are low hanging branches obstructing parking, making getting in and out of vehicles difficult. One scratched my young son as he left the car, causing injury and bleeding. It's lucky it didn't go in his eye. I have seen people take matters into their own hands by snapping small branches off, but this really isn't good enough, particularly given the high level of council tax we are paying you. I am also paying services charges as you are the leaseholder. Additionally, due to continued inaction, as much as 75% or more of the light is being blocked from my living room. I have waited patiently for a year as I know the council is busy and balancing competing priorities, but I really need you to take action now to keep Camden residents safe and protect our physical and mental health. I suffer Seasonal Affective Disorder and my flat is on the ground floor. It is very difficult sitting in the dark in my only room except the bedroom, particularly in the winter. If you continue to be too busy, I would be happy to withold my Council Tax and service charge for a couple of months and then pay a tree surgeon to attend to the matter myself? Please let me know if you would like me to proceed in this way. I will wait a further two weeks to hear from you and if you don't reply, or confirm a firm time frame for when you will address this problem, I will assume you agree with my proposed plan to withold payments for council services (such as maintaining the highway in residential areas safely). I will then pay to sort this out myself. Thank you for your consideration of this complaint. I really hope someone can now help. Laura Orger - 20A Dartmouth Park Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartmouth Park Avenue, Dartmouth Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the road, outside of 24 England's Lane, 26th August
item.description:
Vehicles driving through this deepening/over the manhole cover cause vibrations to our building. This has significantly worsen with the new heavy electric C11 buses replacing the old diesel buses and since buses 46 and 268 are being diverted via England's Lane (1 bus every few minutes now; some of them speeding) the vibrations have intensified to a worrying level (like an earthquake) and cracks started to appear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, England's Lane, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
